template.description: An alternative name for an existing object
template.name: alias

template.description: Defines the relationships between the input and output elements
template.name: architecture

templates.template: architecture ${architecture_name} of ${entity_name} is -- Declarations ${cursor} begin -- concurrent end ${architecture_name};

template.description: Used to declare an array data type.
template.name: array

template.description: Indicates the beginning of an assert statement.
template.name: assert

template.description: Describes a characteristic of a given object.
template.name: attribute

templates.template: attribute ${attribute_name} : string; attribute ${attribute_name} of ${attribute_desination} : label is ${value}; ${cursor}

template.description: Concurrent statement used to represent a portion of a design.
template.name: block

template.description: Is a sequential statement
template.name: case

templates.template: case ${expression} is when ${choice} => ${sequential_statement}; ${cursor} when others => ${sequential_statement}; end case;

template.description: Is used to define the interface to a lower-level design
template.name: component

template.description: A declaration used to create a configuration for an entity.
template.name: configuration

templates.template: configuration ${config_name} of ${entity_name} is for ${architecture_name} for ${instance_label} : ${component_name} use entity ${library_name}.${entity_name}(${arch_name}); for ${arch_name} ${cursor} end for; endfor; end for; end ${config_name};

template.description: Declares a constant of a type specified in the constant
template.name: constant

template.description: Declaration used to describe the interface of a design entity.
template.name: entity

template.description: A sequential statement used in a loop to cause execution to jump
template.name: exit

template.description: Declares a file.
template.name: file

template.description: For loop statement
template.name: for

template.description: Defines a group of sequential statements that return a single
template.name: function

templates.template: function ${function_name} (${parameter_list}) return ${type} is -- declarations begin ${cursor} end ${function_name};

template.description: Used to create regular structures or conditional structures during elaboration.
template.name: generate

template.description: Used to parameterize a design entity.
template.name: generic

template.description: A sequential statement which executes one branch from a set of branches.
template.name: if

templates.template: if (${condition_1}) then ${cursor} elsif (${condition_2}) then else end if;

template.description: An integer type represents a mathematical integer.
template.name: integer

template.description: Defines a library name.
template.name: library

template.description: A sequential statement used to execute a set of sequential statements
template.name: loop

template.description: A sequential statement which jumps back to the top of a loop.
template.name: next

template.description: A sequential statement that does nothing.
template.name: null

template.description: The package declaration defines the external interface to the package,
template.name: package

template.description: The package body typically contains the bodies of any functions or procedures.
template.name: package body

template.description: Used to group together executable, sequential statements.
template.name: procedure

template.description: A concurrent statement which describes behaviour.
template.name: process

template.description: A range specifies a range of values belonging to an integer, floating, physical or enumeration type.
template.name: range down

template.description: A range specifies a range of values belonging to an integer, floating, physical or enumeration type.
template.name: range up

template.description: A data type that represents a set of values of different types.
template.name: record

template.description: A sequential statement which writes out a text message to the simulator log.
template.name: report

template.description: A sequential statement which causes execution to be returned from a
template.name: return

template.description: A concurrent statement which assigns one of several expressions to a signal.
template.name: select

template.description: Used to declare a signal
template.name: signal

template.description: A sequential or concurrent statement which creates events on a signal.
template.name: signal assignment

template.description: Assigns a new value to the target
template.name: signal concurrent

template.description: Results in combinatorial logic.
template.name: signal conditional

template.description: Takes effect only when the process suspends.
template.name: signal sequential

template.description: Standard Logic Vector
template.name: sldlv

template.description: Standard Logic
template.name: std

template.description: A string is a value for a one-dimensional array of characters.
template.name: string

template.description: A subtype declaration is used to give an explicit name to a subtype.
template.name: subtype

template.description: used to define a scalar type
template.name: type

template.description: Makes names defined in a library or package directly visible within another
template.name: use

template.description: A variable stores a value within a process.
template.name: variable

template.description: A sequential statement which waits for an event on a signal in the sensitivity list, for a Condition to become true, or for a timeout.
template.name: wait

templates.template: wait on ${sensitivity_list}; wait until ${condition}; wait for ${time_expression}; wait;

template.description: The statements inside the while loop are executed repeatedly while the condition is True.
template.name: while
